summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, to the assembly of Thessalonians in God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ought to give thanks to God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because increase greatly doth your faith, and abound doth the love of each one of you all, to one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we ourselves do glory in you in the assemblies of God, for your endurance and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye bear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a token of the righteous judgment of God, for your being counted worthy of the reign of God, for which also ye suffer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since [it is] a righteous thing with God to give back to those troubling you -- trouble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to you who are troubled -- rest with us in the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven, with messengers of his power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in flaming fire, giving vengeance to those not knowing God, and to those not obeying the good news of our Lord Jesus Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall suffer justice -- destruction age-during -- from the face of the Lord, and from the glory of his strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when He may come to be glorified in his saints, and to be wondered at in all those believing -- because our testimony was believed among you -- in that day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which also we do pray always for you, that our God may count you worthy of the calling, and may fulfil all the good pleasure of goodness, and the work of the faith in power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we ask you, brethren, in regard to the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ, and of our gathering together unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye be not quickly shaken in mind, nor be troubled, neither through spirit, neither through word, neither through letters as through us, as that the day of Christ hath arrived;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let not any one deceive you in any manner, because -- if the falling away may not come first, and the man of sin be revealed -- the son of the destruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is opposing and is raising himself up above all called God or worshipped, so that he in the sanctuary of God as God hath sat down, shewing himself off that he is God -- [the day doth not come].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye not remember that, being yet with you, these things I said to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, what is keeping down ye have known, for his being revealed in his own time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the secret of the lawlessness doth already work, only he who is keeping down now [will hinder] -- till he may be out of the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then shall be revealed the Lawless One, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the manifestation of his presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [him,] whose presence is according to the working of the Adversary, in all power, and signs, and lying wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in all deceitfulness of the unrighteousness in those perishing, because the love of the truth they did not receive for their being saved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because of this shall God send to them a working of delusion, for their believing the lie,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they may be judged -- all who did not believe the truth, but were well pleased in the unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we -- we ought to give thanks to God always for you, brethren, beloved by the Lord, that God did choose you from the beginning to salvation, in sanctification of the Spirit, and belief of the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to which He did call you through our good news, to the acquiring of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so, then, brethren, stand ye fast, and hold the deliverances that ye were taught, whether through word, whether through our letter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and our God and Father, who did love us, and did give comfort age-during, and good hope in grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: comfort your hearts, and establish you in every good word and work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to the rest, pray ye, brethren, concerning us, that the word of the Lord may run and may be glorified, as also with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that we may be delivered from the unreasonable and evil men, for the faith [is] not of all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and stedfast is the Lord, who shall establish you, and shall guard [you] from the evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that the things that we command you ye both do and will do;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord direct your hearts to the love of God, and to the endurance of the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to withdraw yourselves from every brother disorderly walking, and not after the deliverance that ye received from us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for yourselves have known how it behoveth [you] to imitate us, because we did not act disorderly among you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor for nought did we eat bread of any one, but in labour and in travail, night and day working, not to be chargeable to any of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not because we have not authority, but that ourselves a pattern we might give to you, to imitate us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for even when we were with you, this we did command you, that if any one is not willing to work, neither let him eat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we hear of certain walking among you disorderly, nothing working, but over working,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and such we command and exhort through our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness working, their own bread they may eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye, brethren, may ye not be weary doing well,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if any one do not obey our word through the letter, this one note ye, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as an enemy count [him] not, but admonish ye [him] as a brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may the Lord of the peace Himself give to you the peace always in every way; the Lord [is] with you all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The salutation by the hand of me, Paul, which is a sign in every letter; thus I write;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [is] with you all! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
